sen.j: 八条上杉家（はちじょううえすぎけ）は、上杉氏の諸家のひとつ。
sen.e: The Hachijo Uesugi family is one of the many branches of the Uesugi clan.

sen.e: The Hachijo branch was founded by Tomoaki UESUGI, the son of Tomosada UESUGI of the Futahashi Uesugi family.

sen.j: 室町時代には京都壬生に拠点を置き、越後国鵜川荘などを領していた。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period the family's power base was in Mibu village in Kyoto, but they also controlled other territory such as Ukawa manor in Echigo province.

sen.j: 享徳の乱では山内・越後上杉氏らと共に五十子に在陣している。
sen.e: During the Kyotoku War, the Hachijo branch joined with the Yamauchi and Echigo Uesugi clans, who all sent their soldiers to camp at Irako.

sen.j: 戦国時代(日本)になると越後国に下り、八条龍松を上杉房能の養子とするなどして越後への政治的介入を強めたが、その過程で越後守護代長尾氏と対立するようになる。
sen.e: Once the Sengoku period (Japan's Warring States period) began, the family relocated to Echigo province, strengthening their involvement in local politics in Echigo through such means as arranging to have Ryumatsu HACHIJO adopted by Fusayoshi UESUGI; in the process, however, they came into conflict with Echigo's Shugodai (deputy governor) family, the Nagao clan.

sen.j: 永正3年（1506年）に長尾能景が越中で戦死し跡を長尾為景が継ぐと両者の対立は表面化し、越後永正の乱では八条尾張守・龍松父子や上杉成定が自害に追い込まれるなどして大きな打撃を受けた。
sen.e: The antagonism between the two families broke out into the open in 1506 after Yoshikage NAGAO died in battle in Ecchu and was succeeded by Tamekage NAGAO; the Hachijo family suffered a major blow in Echigo's Eisho War, during which Ryumatsu HACHIJO, the governor of Owari, and his son, as well as Narisada UESUGI, were driven to take their own lives.
